name: Introduction to Engineering
description: This course is an introduction to the overall field of engineering and covers topics such as engineering design, mathematics, ethics, and communications.

name: Introduction to Computer Engineering
description: This course introduces students to the basic concepts of computer engineering, including digital logic, computer architecture, computer programming, and computer systems.

name: Computer Architecture
description: This course covers the fundamentals of computer architecture, including instruction sets, memory systems, microarchitecture, and performance.

name: Digital Logic Design
description: This course covers the fundamentals of digital logic, including Boolean algebra, logic gates, combinatorial circuits, and sequential circuits.

name: Computer Programming
description: This course covers the fundamentals of computer programming, including data types, control structures, algorithms, and debugging.

name: Computer Systems
description: This course covers the fundamentals of computer systems, including operating systems, computer networks, and computer security.
